title: 9.6 Second Averaged Interplanetary Magnetic Field - Adam Szabo (NASA GSFC)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch2' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/voyager/voyager2/magnetic_fields_cdaweb/mag_10s/1977/voyager2_10s_mag_19770820_v01.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 99.3371% of the 385740 timesteps. Cadence = 9600 [ms] = PT9.6S.

parameters.name: B_error
parameters.description: V2 Fixed B Error. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function error_bar_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['F1']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: F1
parameters.description: B-Magnitude by Method 1 (F1): 9.6 second average of 1.92 second magnitudes

parameters.name: F2
parameters.description: ---> B-Magnitude by Method 2 (F2): average derived from 9.6 second component averages=sqrt(B1**2+B2**2+B3**2)

parameters.name: B1
parameters.description: ---> BR (B1): 9.6 second average of 1.92 second averages of the B-radial component in HG coords

parameters.name: B2
parameters.description: ---> BT (B2): 9.6 second average of 1.92 second averages of the B-tangential component in HG coords

parameters.name: B3
parameters.description: ---> BN (B3): 9.6 second average of 1.92 second averages of the B-normal component in HG coords

parameters.name: F1_100nt
parameters.description: [100nT Plot Scale] B-Magnitude by Method 1 (F1): 9.6 second average of 1.92 second magnitudes. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['F1']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
